intro: Cenarrhenes spathulifolia, commonly known as the broad-leafed cenarrhenes, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features broad, lance-shaped leaves and produces yellow to orange flowers that bloom in the spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open grasslands or forest edges. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
